title: ArcBridge How-To
summary: Use this guide to navigate every core workflow in ArcBridge.
content:
ArcBridge helps you ingest **Guild Wars 2 arcdps logs**, analyze combat performance, and share outputs with your squad.

## ![Map](icon:list-tree) How to use this guide

- Use the **Guide Map** on the left to jump by area.
- Use the **breadcrumbs** at the top to move up/down the hierarchy.
- Start with **Getting Started** for setup, then move to **Dashboard**, **Stats View**, and **Sharing**.

> ![Tip](icon:check) Tip: For troubleshooting, jump to the **Troubleshooting** node at any time.

children.title: Getting Started
children.summary: Initial setup, first upload flow, and what to expect.
children.content:
## ![Check](icon:check) Setup checklist

- Open ArcBridge and set your **Log Directory** to your `arcdps.cbtlogs` folder.
- Confirm uploads are pointed at your intended output path (Discord mode, Web mode, or both).
- Optionally add your `dps.report` user token in Settings.

## ![Upload](icon:upload) First ingest workflow

1. Configure the log directory.
2. Add one or more `.zevtc` files (manual or watched ingestion).
3. Wait for status transitions (`queued -> uploading -> success`, or error states).
4. Verify fight cards include metadata (fight name, time, links, and computed details).

## ![Error](icon:alert-triangle) Common first-run checks

- If no logs appear, verify the folder path and permissions.
- If uploads fail, review status text and your webhook/token configuration.
- If details are delayed, wait for parsing and aggregation to complete.

children.title: Dashboard
children.summary: Operational view for ingest, statuses, and per-fight actions.
children.content:
## ![Live](icon:activity) Live Operations Surface

The Dashboard is your command center for managing logs and active uploads. It provides a real-time view of your current session's activity.

## ![Card](icon:file) Anatomy of a Fight Card

Each log appears as a card with rich metadata and status indicators:

- **Status Icons**:
  - ![Queued](icon:clock) `QUE`: Queued for processing.
  - ![Pending](icon:upload) `PEN`: Pending upload slot.
  - ![Uploading](icon:globe) `...`: Uploading to dps.report.
  - ![Calc](icon:bar-chart) `CAL`: Calculating statistics locally.
  - ![Success](icon:check) `LOG`: Success! Ready to view.
  - ![Error](icon:error) `ERR`: Failed (hover for details).

- **Metrics Preview**: Once processed, cards show quick stats:
  - ![Time](icon:clock) **Duration**: Fight length.
  - ![DPS](icon:activity) **Squad DPS**: Total group output.
  - ![Downs](icon:error) **Downs/Deaths**: Quick survival check.

## ![Batch](icon:layers) Batch Operations

You can manage multiple logs at once:

1. **Select**: Click the checkboxes on valid logs.
2. **Bulk Actions**: Use the bottom bar to:
   - ![Upload](icon:upload) **Upload Selected**: Retry or force upload to web.
   - ![Copy](icon:file) **Copy Links**: Grab all dps.report links at once.
   - ![Open](icon:globe) **Open**: Launch multiple browser tabs.

## ![Tips](icon:check) Best practices

- **Watch Mode**: Enable 'Watch' in the sidebar to auto-import logs as they are created by ArcDPS.
- **Error Handling**: If a log gets stuck, try the 'Retry' button or check if the backend service is down.
- **Session Management**: Use 'Clear All' to start fresh for a new raid wing or strike mission.

children.title: Stats View
children.summary: Deep analysis of aggregated session performance.
children.content:
## ![Stats](icon:bar-chart) Deep Session Analysis

Stats View combines all selected logs into a single **session-level** report. This is where you find patterns across multiple fights.

## ![Chart](icon:activity) Analysis Sections

The sidebar gives you access to 16+ detailed breakdowns:

- **Core**:
  - ![Home](icon:dashboard) **Overview**: High-level trends (DPS, Cleanses, Strips).
  - ![Fight](icon:activity) **Fight Breakdown**: Table of every fight with duration and success status.
  - ![Top](icon:bar-chart) **Top Players**: MVP rankings based on your weighted scoring.
- **Combat**:
  - ![Sword](icon:activity) **Offense/Defense/Support**: Traditional role breakdowns.
  - ![Heal](icon:heart) **Healing**: Outgoing healing distribution (if available).
- **Technical**:
  - ![Buff](icon:arrow-up) **Boons/Buffs**: Uptime and generation stats.
  - ![Condi](icon:droplet) **Conditions**: Incoming and outgoing pressure.
  - ![Time](icon:clock) **Timeline**: Visual progression of the session.
  - ![Skill](icon:sliders) **Skill Usage**: Deep dive into rotation efficiency (cancels, casts).

## ![Nav](icon:dashboard) Navigation Tips

- ![Search](icon:folder) **Search**: Use the top search bar to filter for specific players/accounts.
- ![Mode](icon:sliders) **Mode Toggles**: Switch between **Total** (accumulated) and **Per Second** (intensity) views in Settings.
- ![Export](icon:upload) **Export**: Use the camera icon to save the current view for Discord.

children.title: Sharing
children.summary: Output workflows for Discord, screenshots, and web reports.
children.content:
## ![Share](icon:globe) Sharing options

- **Discord Embed/Image**: fast in-chat delivery.
- **Stats screenshot export**: visual snapshot for announcements.
- **Web upload**: persistent, browsable report hosting.

## ![Select](icon:mouse-pointer) Choosing the right output

- Use Discord when your squad needs rapid summaries.
- Use web reports when you want historical links and richer browsing.
- Use screenshots for one-click, visual, low-friction communication.

## ![Check](icon:shield) Reliability checks

- Validate webhook and token before high-volume posting.
- Confirm web publish URL resolves after upload/build completion.
- If output looks stale, re-run with fresh logs and confirm build status.

children.title: Settings & Integrations
children.summary: Central control for behavior, metrics, visuals, and integrations.
children.content:
## ![Config](icon:settings) Configuration Center

Control every aspect of ArcBridge, from visual themes to deep metric weighting.

## ![Controls](icon:sliders) Key Configurations

### ![Theme](icon:palette) General & Appearance
- **Theme**: Switch between Classic, Modern, and accessible Contrast modes.
- **Auto-Update**: Toggle background checks for new versions.

### ![Connect](icon:plug) Discord Integration
- **Notification Mode**: Choose **Embed** (rich card) or **Image** (visual summary).
- **Split Enemies by Team**: In **Settings -> Discord Embed - Summary Sections**, enable this to split enemy summary and class breakdown by enemy `Team <id>` (ally team excluded) across Embed, Image, and Tiled notifications.
- **Webhooks**: Set separate destinations for automated upload alerts vs manual shares.

### ![Stats](icon:bar-chart) Stats Engine
- **MVP Weights**: Customize how the "Top Player" score is calculated (e.g., value Revives higher than DPS).
- **Disruption Tracking**: Choose whether to count CC by **number of hits** or **duration** of breakbar damage.

### ![Data](icon:database) Data Management
- **Exports**: Save your full configuration to a file (great for backups).
- **Cache**: Clear local processed data to free up space or fix display glitches.

children.title: GitHub Web Reports
children.summary: Hosted report pipeline using GitHub repositories and Pages.
children.content:
## ![Web](icon:github) Web Report Hosting

ArcBridge integrates directly with GitHub Pages to publish your reports to the web.

## ![Rocket](icon:rocket) Workflow Overview

1. ![Link](icon:link) **Connect**: Link your GitHub account to ArcBridge.
2. ![Repo](icon:folder) **Repository**: Choose where to store your report files.
3. ![Theme](icon:palette) **Customize**: Pick a visual theme and upload a squad logo.
4. ![Globe](icon:globe) **Publish**: Every time you upload via the Dashboard, your site updates.

## ![Setup](icon:file) Setup Guide

- **Repositories**: You can use an existing repo or let ArcBridge create a new private 'report-host' for you.
- **Pages**: This feature turns your repository into a website. ArcBridge handles the complex configuration for you.

## ![Settings](icon:settings) Troubleshooting

- **Auth Errors**: If uploads fail, try reconnecting your account in this tab.
- **Build Delays**: GitHub takes 30-60s to publish changes. Check the 'Build Status' indicator here.

children.title: Connect & Authorize
children.summary: Authenticate and target the repository for publishing.
children.content:
## ![Steps](icon:list-tree) Step-by-step (beginner friendly)

### ![Link](icon:link) 1. Start connection in ArcBridge

- Open **Settings -> GitHub Web Reports**.
- Click the connect/authenticate action.
- ArcBridge will show a short verification code and a GitHub URL.

### ![Shield](icon:shield) 2. Complete verification on GitHub

- Open the provided GitHub verification page.
- Sign in to your GitHub account (if not already signed in).
- Enter the code shown by ArcBridge.
- Approve access when prompted.

After approval, ArcBridge should show a connected/authenticated state.

### ![Folder](icon:folder) 3. Choose where reports should be stored

You can either:

- Select an existing repository, or
- Create a new repository from ArcBridge.

If you're new, creating a dedicated repo just for reports is usually easiest.

### ![Check](icon:check) 4. Confirm repo details

Verify these values in Settings:

- **Owner**: your GitHub username or org.
- **Repository name**: target repo for report files.
- **Branch**: usually `main`.
- **Pages URL**: generated website URL used for sharing.

## ![Check](icon:check) First-time validation checklist

- Auth state says connected.
- Repo is selectable and saved.
- Pages URL appears.
- No current error banner in the GitHub section.

## ![Error](icon:alert-triangle) Common beginner issues

- **Wrong account signed in**: sign out/in on GitHub and reconnect.
- **Repo not visible**: ensure permissions and refresh repo list.
- **Connection says error**: retry auth; token may be expired/revoked.
- **Pages URL missing**: wait for repo setup/template steps, then retry.

children.title: Theme & Branding
children.summary: Set report visuals and keep published branding consistent.
children.content:
## ![Control](icon:sliders) What this section controls

- **Web theme**: visual style/colors/layout for published reports.
- **Logo**: image shown in your report branding area.
- **Template sync**: ensures the hosted report structure is up to date.

## ![Flow](icon:layers) Recommended beginner workflow

1. Connect GitHub and select repo first.
2. Choose your theme in ArcBridge.
3. Optionally select a logo file.
4. Apply/sync changes.
5. Wait for build status to complete.
6. Open the Pages URL and confirm visuals.

## ![Image](icon:file) Logo guidance

- Prefer a clean PNG or SVG with transparent background.
- Avoid extremely large files.
- If logo looks stretched, try a square or balanced aspect ratio.

## ![Check](icon:check) How to verify your changes

- Build status should move from pending/checking to success.
- Refresh the published URL in browser after build finishes.
- Confirm theme colors and logo match what you selected.

## ![Help](icon:alert-triangle) If customization doesn't show up

- Re-run apply theme/logo.
- Confirm repo/branch are correct.
- Check build status for errors.
- Hard-refresh browser cache on the report URL.

children.title: Troubleshooting
children.summary: Rapid diagnosis path for ingest, stats, and publish failures.
children.content:
## ![Fix](icon:settings) Solving Common Issues

If something isn't working, check these first steps.

## ![Question](icon:help-circle) Frequently Asked Questions

### ![Folder](icon:folder) Logs aren't showing up?
- Verify your **Log Directory** in the Dashboard matches where ArcDPS saves files.
- Ensure **Watch Mode** is enabled if you want auto-import.

### ![Upload](icon:upload) Uploads failing?
- Check your **Discord Webhook** URL.
- If using GitHub, check the **Build Status** in Settings -> GitHub.

### ![Chart](icon:bar-chart) Stats missing?
- Some stats (like Healing) need specific ArcDPS extensions.
- Check **Settings -> Stats Engine** to ensure you haven't hidden sections.

## ![Heart](icon:heart) Getting Help

If you're stuck, join the [Support Discord](https://discord.gg/UjzMXMGXEg).
- Post your log file (if possible).
- Share a screenshot of the error message.
